Rebecca Stewart

Bath, United Kingdom · rebeccalstewart@outlook.com

A committed IT professional with over six years of developer experience and two years experience in IT Support. Rebecca takes an analytical approach to her work and has strong enthusiasm towards continuously improving her skills. Currently, out of work due to COVID-19 redundancy, looking for the right opportunity.

Experience

Data & Operations Developer

Armadillo CRM

Armadillo is a creative agency that specialize in Customer Relationship Marketing. As Data and Operations Developer I provide internal IT Support, manage the McDonald's CRM database and sent large scale CRM campaigns.

Duties:

  • Diagnosing and resolving IT Issues, responding queries with a timely and friendly response.
  • Establishing accounts & hardware for new employees.
  • Monitoring the company network.
  • Tracking and managing access to systems, equipment and passwords.
  • Evaluating software licences reducing any unnecessary costs.
  • Managing inventory and placing orders for new hardware when required.
  • Controlling a number of internal and external servers including a file server, a database server and a number of AWS cloud servers used for larger campaigns.
  • Creating and updating documentation for all IT and data processes.
  • Communicating with employees making them aware of issues such as planned IT outages.
  • Management of the McDonald's UK CRM MySQL database with tasks including handling, importing/exporting, troubleshooting, and processing data.
  • Set up of campaigns for broadcast including creative set up, data segmentations and broadcast timings.
July 18 - Present

Junior Web Developer

Armadillo CRM

Working for brands such as The Walt Disney Company, McDonald's UK and Babyliss developing HTML emails and landing pages.

Duties:

  • Turning approved client design files into web standard assets for HTML build.
  • Creation of emails and landing pages to the industry’s best standards, using languages such as HTML, CSS, JavaScript and PHP.
  • Use of testing software and physical devices to ensure correct rendering across all platforms and email clients.
  • Using own initiative to problem-solve any rendering issues.
  • Quality assurance checks of other developer's campaign and website builds.
  • Working with the Design team to advise best practices.
  • Communicating with the Client Services team to raise any issues.
December 2016 - July 2018

Junior Web Developer

RACS Marketing

RACS Marketing was a full service marketing agency based in Warminster. In this role I was responsible front end website development for external clients. It was also my role to manage and update internal websites for brands under the RACS Group umbrella.

Duties:

  • Website development using a range of methods including Wordpress, a bespoke CMS and standard HTML/CSS.
  • Updating and managing internal websites.
  • Communication with clients to provide ongoing technical support and status updates on current builds.
  • Testing of websites to ensure device and browser compatibility.
  • Management of internal and external social media accounts.
  • Producing Google Analytics reports for clients and management.
July 2014 - December 2016

Other Experience

Student Proctor

Coventry University

Due to my achievements in my second year of university at Coventry University, I was selected to become a Student Proctor in my third year. The role involved being a student teaching assistant, helping out in workshops of first-year Business Information Technology and third-year Public History.

Duties:

  • Helping first year Business Information Technology (BIT) students with setting up Raspberry Pi servers.
  • Supporting BIT students by helping them learn the basics of UML and the Python programming language.
  • Providing technical support to third year History students.
  • Reading lecture material ahead of lab sessions to ensure a strong knowledge of subjects covered.
September 2013 - April 2014

Customer Care Assistant & Crew Member

McDonald's

Working for one of the worlds largest fast-food brands in restaurants located in Birmingham and then Bath. I was first employed as a Crew Member where I would serve customers and prepare food and next as a Customer Care Assistant taking care of the dining area and assisting customer needs.

Duties:

  • Providing the highest quality customer service to all customers.
  • Ensuring cleanliness of customer facing and staff  areas.
  • Adhering to food hygiene regulations at all times.
  • Preparation of food.
  • Carrying out general maintenance tasks.
  • Working as a team to ensure targets were met.
November 2009 - July 2014

Interests

Aside from technology, I enjoy getting out into the great outdoors, going on long hikes and climbing mountains with friends. I particularly enjoy travelling to the Brecon Beacons in Wales. In May 2019 a group of friends and I climbed Snowdon at night, reaching the summit in the early hours of the morning to watch the sunrise across Snowdonia, raising over £3000 for the mental health charity Mind.

When I am not hiking, I enjoy exercising. Due to COVID-19 I am no longer able to go to the gym so instead enjoy home workouts in my garden.

To relax I enjoy gaming, with my favourite console being my Ninendo Switch.
